summary.title: Nuclarity
summary.description: PET image enhancement software product NUCLARITY

threats.title: Unauthorized access via spoofed identity tokens
threats.description: An attacker might use stolen credentials to authenticate as a legitimate user.
threats.mitigation:
Implement continuous monitoring for unusual login patterns and securily store client credentials on
MDDS. Rotate credentials periodically.

threats.title: Inability to audit or log user activities accurately
threats.description: An attacker denies performing an action without traceability.
threats.mitigation: Enable detailed logging and auditing features in Cognito to capture user activities.

threats.title: Leakage of sensitive user information or credentials
threats.description: Exposure of sensitive user information due to misconfigurations or security weaknesses.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption for data at rest and in transit, and regularly review IAM policies and access controls.

threats.title: Alteration of API requests or responses in transit
threats.description: An attacker modifies the API request or response data in transit, potentially altering functionality or stealing data.
threats.mitigation: Implement HTTPS for all traffic, validate all requests and responses, and use WAF to detect and block malicious requests.

threats.title: Overloading API Gateway with requests leading to service disruption
threats.description:
Overloading API Gateway with a high volume of requests, causing disruption of
service.
threats.mitigation: Use rate limiting and AWS Shield for DDoS protection.

threats.title: Unintended exposure of backend information via error messages or misconfigurations.
threats.description: Unintended exposure of backend information through error messages or misconfigured APIs.
threats.mitigation: Implement proper error handling that masks sensitive details and review API Gateway logging settings.

threats.title: Misconfigured bucket permissions allowing public or unauthorized access
threats.description: Data leaks resulting from misconfigured S3 bucket permissions, making data publicly accessible unintentionally.
threats.mitigation: Regularly audit S3 bucket policies and ACLs, use AWS Trusted Advisor to identify and rectify permissions issues, and enable default encryption for all objects stored in S3.

threats.title: Unauthorized changes to data stored in S3 buckets
threats.description: Unauthorized alteration of data stored in S3 buckets, leading to corruption or loss.
threats.mitigation:
Enable S3 versioning to keep multiple variants of an object in the same bucket, use MFA Delete
capability, and configure bucket policies to restrict who can modify data.

threats.title: Excessive operations or large object uploads consuming bandwidth or storage
threats.description: Excessive, unintended operations (GET, PUT) or large object uploads that consume excessive bandwidth or storage, impacting service availability.
threats.mitigation:
Implement request rate limiting, monitor traffic with AWS CloudTrail, and use lifecycle policies to
archive or delete old/unneeded objects.

threats.title: Impersonating the container to interact with other services
threats.description: An attacker impersonates the Nuclarity container to interact with other services or containers fraudulently.
threats.mitigation:
Utilize mutual TLS (mTLS) for service-to-service communications, implement strict IAM roles for
ECS tasks, and enforce authentication at the API level.

threats.title: Malicious modification of the container’s runtime configuration
threats.description: Malicious modification of the container’s runtime configuration or code, potentially altering the behavior of the container.
threats.mitigation:
Implement image signing and verification using Docker Content Trust or similar technologies. Use
read-only filesystems where possible and restrict runtime privileges.

threats.title: Exploiting vulnerabilities within the container or the host to gain elevated privileges
threats.description: An attacker exploits vulnerabilities within the container or the host to gain elevated privileges.
threats.mitigation: Limit container privileges using least privilege principles and utilize AWS IAM roles for tasks.

threats.title: Overloading the NLB to disrupt legitimate traffic handling
threats.description: Unauthorized modification of NLB configuration settings that could reroute traffic or degrade service quality.
threats.mitigation: Restrict access to NLB configuration settings using IAM roles. Enable logging and monitoring of all changes using AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch.

threats.title: Intercepting or altering traffic routed through the NLB
threats.description: Unauthorized modification of NLB configuration settings that could reroute traffic or degrade service quality.
threats.mitigation: Restrict access to NLB configuration settings using IAM roles. Enable logging and monitoring of all changes using AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch.

threats.title: Mimicking legitimate services behind the NLB to capture traffic
threats.description: An attacker impersonates the NLB or backend systems to intercept or redirect traffic.
threats.mitigation: Use TLS listeners to secure data in transit and ensure authenticity. Implement network ACLs and security groups to restrict traffic only to known sources and destinations.

threats.title: Unauthorized modifications to container images.
threats.description: Unauthorized modifications to container images stored in ECR, potentially introducing malware or other malicious changes.
threats.mitigation: Use ECR image scanning to detect vulnerabilities or unauthorized changes, enable image immutability, and restrict push/pull access via IAM roles.

threats.title: Exposure of sensitive information through image configurations or layers
threats.description: Exposure of sensitive data embedded in Docker images or configuration files.
threats.mitigation: Implement least privilege access controls, use private repositories, and scan images for sensitive data using automated tools before pushing to ECR.

threats.title: Overloading ECR with requests or pushing oversized images
threats.description: Overloading the registry with a large number of requests or large images, potentially impacting the availability.
threats.mitigation: Set quotas and request rate limits on repository operations, monitor usage patterns, and configure alerts for anomalous activities.

threats.title: Unauthorized access to data stored in DynamoDB
threats.description: Unauthorized access to data stored in DynamoDB.
threats.mitigation: Enable encryption at rest, use fine-grained access controls, and regularly audit access logs.

threats.title: Unauthorized modification of data.
threats.description: Data in DynamoDB is modified or deleted without authorization.
threats.mitigation: Implement conditional writes, enable versioning where applicable, and use access control mechanisms to restrict data modification.

threats.title: Flooding DynamoDB with high volume requests to disrupt service.
threats.description: High request rates or large item sizes cause throughput issues, impacting database performance.
threats.mitigation: Use DynamoDB Auto Scaling, monitor performance metrics, and implement partitioning strategies.

threats.title: Failure to log important security events, allowing malicious activities to go undetected
threats.description:
Insufficient logging that fails to capture important security events, allowing malicious activities to go
undetected.
threats.mitigation: Configure CloudWatch Logs to capture all critical logs from AWS resources, ensure log integrity and immutability, and regularly audit log configurations.

threats.title: Unauthorized access to logs containing sensitive information
threats.description: Unauthorized access to logs containing sensitive or confidential information.
threats.mitigation:
Implement strict IAM policies that limit access to logs, enable encryption for CloudWatch Logs at
rest using KMS, and use log data masking where necessary.

threats.title: Altering or deleting logs to hide malicious activity
threats.description: Unauthorized modification or deletion of logs to hide malicious activity.
threats.mitigation: Enable access logging for CloudWatch, use multifactor authentication for log access, and ensure logs are stored in an immutable format.

threats.title: Execution of unauthorized commands or access to resources due to overly permissive IAM roles.
threats.description: An attacker exploits overly permissive IAM roles assigned to Lambda functions to gain unauthorized access to other AWS services.
threats.mitigation: Apply the principle of least privilege to IAM roles. Regularly audit permissions and use IAM policies that limit access scope.

threats.title: Modifying the code or environment variables of the Lambda function.
threats.description: Unauthorized modification of Lambda code or environment configurations leading to altered functionality.
threats.mitigation: Use version control for Lambda functions and restrict deployment permissions.

threats.title: Triggering Lambda to exhaust resources
threats.description: Triggering Lambda to exhaust resources, e.g., through infinite loops or excessive resource consumption.
threats.mitigation: Implement concurrency limits and cost control measures, and monitor execution patterns.
